meanings.sent1: The toad had a wartier skin than any other creature in the swamp.
meanings.sent2: The wartier growth on the tree trunk indicated a fungal infection.
meanings.sent3: The witch's wartier potion bubbled and steamed in her cauldron.
meanings.sent4: The wartier surface of the moon made it look like a giant pockmarked orb.
meanings.sent5: The wartier texture of the rock felt rough and uneven to the touch.

meanings.definition: Having the quality of a wart
meanings.sent1: The wartier growth on the plant made it look unhealthy.
meanings.sent2: Her wartier personality often rubbed people the wrong way.
meanings.sent3: The wartier taste of the medicine made him grimace in disgust.
meanings.sent4: The wartier appearance of the old building gave it a spooky vibe.
meanings.sent5: The wartier texture of the fabric felt unpleasant against her skin.

meanings.sent1: The wartier bumps on the surface of the fruit made it unappealing.
meanings.sent2: The wartier growth on the statue made it look ancient and weathered.
meanings.sent3: The wartier pattern on the wallpaper seemed to move when you stared at it.
meanings.sent4: The wartier texture of the painting gave it a unique and interesting look.
meanings.sent5: The wartier feel of the carpet under his feet was unexpected and strange.
